00b1995e31.gt:
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Season pork ribs with salt and pepper.
Working in two batches, sear the pork until light golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
As each batch of pork is seared, place it in the bottom of the crockpot.
Pour out all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings.
Add shallots and garlic to the pot.
Saute until the shallots are light golden brown.
Add tomato paste and cook until the paste becomes dark red, approximately 3 minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, red wine, and fish sauce.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Pour the tomato sauce into the crockpot.
Add cannellini beans to the crockpot.
Cook on low heat for 6 to 8 hours, or until the pork is tender.
Remove the pork from the crockpot and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Return the pork to the crockpot and keep warm until ready to serve over rice or pasta (I use egg noodles).
Garnish with chopped fresh Italian parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.
00b1995e31.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the 2 tablespoons of canola oil, salt, pepper, minced shallots, garlic, and tomato paste.
3. Add the country-style pork ribs to the bowl and toss to coat the ribs evenly with the marinade.
4. Transfer the marinated ribs to a large, oven-safe dish or a slow cooker.
5. Pour the canned crushed tomatoes and red wine over the ribs.
6. Add the fish sauce and cannellini beans to the dish.
7. Cover the dish with a lid or a piece of aluminum foil, and cook in the oven for 4-6 hours or in the slow cooker for 6-8 hours on low heat.
8. After cooking, remove the dish from the oven or slow cooker, and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before serving.
9. Garnish the dish with chopped fresh Italian parsley, and serve hot.

[/INST]

723f2696fa.gt:
Preheat the broiler and position a rack 6 inches from the heat.
In a food processor, combine the ricotta with the 2 tablespoons of honey and puree until very smooth.
Arrange the figs cut side up on a rimmed baking sheet.
Dollop 2 teaspoons of the ricotta puree on each fig and lightly drizzle with honey.
Broil for about 2 minutes, until just browned in spots and the ricotta is barely melted; serve warm or at room temperature.
723f2696fa.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the ricotta and honey until smooth.
3. Place the figs on a baking sheet, cut-side up.
4. Drizzle the honey mixture over the figs, ensuring they are evenly coated.
5. Roast the figs in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the figs from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Honey-Broiled Figs with Ricotta as a delicious and healthy dessert or snack.

This dish combines the natural sweetness of honey with the rich, creamy flavor of ricotta, creating a unique and satisfying treat. The combination of fresh figs and ricotta cheese provides a delightful contrast of textures and flavors, making it an enjoyable and nutritious option for those looking for a tasty and healthy dessert or snack.

d4da80f96c.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine 3/4 cup sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, cinnamon, cloves and salt.
Stir in milk, melted butter and vanilla, beating until smooth.
Pour batter into an ungreased 9-inch squre baking pan.
Stir together remaining 1/2 cup sugar, brown sugar, remaining 1/4 cup cocoa and cinnamon.
Sprinkle this evenly over batter in baking dish.
Combine hot water and rum; pour this over top of sugar-cocoa mixture in dish; do not stir.
Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees F until center is almost set.
Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes.
Serve, spooning sauce from bottom of pan over top.
Delicious with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream!
d4da80f96c.pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Cinn-ful Fudgy Rum Pudding Cake, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, cinnamon, ground cloves, and salt.
3. Add the milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the hot water, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased and floured 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
6. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the baking dish and transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cake is fully cooled, dust it with powdered sugar, if desired.

[/INST]

6a483319ff.gt:
Wash the enoki mushrooms, cut off the stem ends and put on a plate.
Put a pat of butter (or margarine) on top.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with cheese (I used sliced cheese) and cover loosely with plastic wrap.
Microwave for about a minute and it's done.
Add a little soy sauce or ponzu sauce before eating.
Enjoy piping hot!
6a483319ff.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the microwave to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, ponzu, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Place the Enoki mushrooms in a microwave-safe dish, and drizzle the soy sauce mixture over them.
4. Cover the dish with a microwave-safe lid or plastic wrap, and microwave for 2-3 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and slightly browned.
5. Remove the dish from the microwave, and let it sit for a minute or two to allow the flavors to meld.
6. In a small bowl, mix the melted butter (or margarine) with a pinch of salt and pepper.
7. Place the slice of cheese on a microwave-safe plate, and drizzle the butter mixture over it.
8. Cover the plate with a microwave-safe lid or plastic wrap, and microwave for 1-2 minutes or until the cheese is melted and slightly browned.
9. Serve the Enoki Mushrooms and Cheese immediately, and enjoy your delicious meal.

9b3acc9089.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with two long sheets of Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil, overlapping them in opposing directions so you make a cross, with plenty of foil at each end to eventually fold over into the center.
Lightly spray with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, stir together cream, shallot and garlic.
Add parsnips, sweet potato and turnip and carefully toss together until all the pieces are well coated.
In another mixing bowl combine 1 cup of cheese, green onion and thyme and toss together.
To assemble, place a single layer of cream-coated root vegetable pieces onto the foil-lined baking sheet and season generously with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle 1/4 of the cheese mixture over the surface.
Repeat with another layer of vegetables, salt and pepper and cheese mixture and continue with this pattern until all the ingredients have been used (finishing with a layer of vegetables).
Bring each side of the excess foil hanging over the baking sheet together and seal tightly, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Bake gratin in the oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender.
Open foil carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil.
Uncover gratin and sprinkle remaining cheese over the top.
Place gratin under a broiler and broil for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until cheese has melted and the top has browned slightly.
Allow gratin to cool for about 10 minutes before cutting up and serving.
9b3acc9089.pred:
To cook a delicious Root Vegetable Gratin using these ingredients, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the heavy cream over medium heat until it begins to simmer.
3. Add the shallot and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the shallot is softened and translucent.
4. Add the sweet potato, parsnips, turnip, and green onion to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still have a slight crunch.
5. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the minced thyme.
7. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a large baking dish or a foil-lined baking sheet.
8. Dot the top of the vegetable mixture with the shredded Gruyere cheese, dividing it evenly.
9. Drizzle the heavy cream over the cheese.
10. Roll out the Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil to create a large, loose-fitting sheet. Place the vegetable mixture inside the foil, leaving a small border around the edges.
11. Fold the foil over the vegetable mixture, creating a sealed packet.
12. Place the foil packet on the prepared baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. Remove the foil packet from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before carefully opening the foil and serving the Root Vegetable Gratin.

Enjoy your delicious Root Vegetable Gratin!

21b8be21c5.gt:
Place all ingredients together in roasting pan.
Bake, uncovered, in 325 oven, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Stir often.
This recipe can be made in a crockpot, as well.
Mix all ingredients together in crockpot, set temperature dial to low setting, cook 4-6 hours.
Stir occasionally.
21b8be21c5.pred:
To cook a delightful Baked Beans dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the pork and beans, chopped white onion, and chopped green pepper. Cook over medium heat until the onions are softened and the beans are heated through.
3. Add the diced raw bacon and cook until it is crispy.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the catsup, brown sugar, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Pour the mixture over the beans and bacon in the saucepan, stirring to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
6. Serve the Baked Beans hot, garnished with fresh chopped green onions if desired.

Ingredients:
- 1 (29 ounce) can pork and beans
- 12 cup chopped white onion
- 12 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 cup diced raw bacon
- 12 cup catsup
- 12 cup brown sugar
- Salt and pepper, to taste

This delicious Baked Beans dish is a crowd-pleaser, with its combination of tender beans, crispy bacon, and sweet and tangy sauce.

dc17b08e51.gt:
Combine first 8 ingredients in a food processor; process until smooth.
Add pepper.
Spoon 1 teaspoon of tapenade over each baguette slice.
Arrange on a serving platter; garnish with orange sections, if desired.
dc17b08e51.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the pitted nicoise olives, capers, and grated orange rind.
3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the extravirgin olive oil, orange juice, fennel seeds, water, garlic cloves, and pepper.
4. Spread the mixture evenly over the toasted baguette slices.
5. Bake the baguette slices in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the croutons are golden brown and crispy.
6. Remove the croutons from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. In a small bowl, mix the orange sections and halved orange with a fork.
8. Serve the croutons with the orange and fennel tapenade as a side dish or topping.

[/INST]

e9acd2e2b9.gt:
Cook couscous in well-salted boiling water, uncovered, until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in sugar snaps 3 minutes before couscous is done.
Drain and transfer to a bowl, then stir in 1/2 tablespoon butter and salt and pepper to taste.
While couscous and sugar snaps cook, toss shrimp with 1/8 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.
Heat remaining tablespoon butter in a 10-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until foam subsides.
Saute shrimp, turning once, until just cooked through, about 3 minutes total.
Transfer shrimp with a slotted spoon to a plate.
Add wine, tomato, and sugar to skillet and boil until tomato starts to fall apart, about 4 minutes.
Return shrimp to skillet and stir in tarragon.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve shrimp and pan sauce on top of pearl couscous.
e9acd2e2b9.pred:
1. In a large pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add the pearl couscous and cook according to the package instructions, usually about 10-12 minutes.
2. While the couscous is cooking, in a large skillet, heat 1/2 tablespoon of the butter over medium heat. Add the sugar snap peas and cook until they are tender but still crisp, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Remove the sugar snap peas from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the dry white wine to the skillet and cook until it has evaporated, about 1-2 minutes.
6. Add the chopped tomato to the skillet and cook until it has softened and released its juices, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Stir in the sugar and tarragon.
8. Combine the cooked couscous and the shrimp mixture in a large bowl.
9. Serve the Shrimp and "Pearls" immediately.

[/INST]

54ea4ac023.gt:
Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch.
Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
Remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes.
Drain.
Cool the eggs under cold running water.
Peel and chop the cooled eggs.
Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate; crumble once cool.
Combine the eggs, bacon, mayonnaise, mozzarella cheese, paprika, sugar, white wine vinegar, and mustard in a bowl to make a chunky dip.
Garnish with paprika.
54ea4ac023.pred:
1. First, crack the eggs into a large mixing bowl and mash them slightly with a fork.
2. Add the mayonnaise, shredded mozzarella cheese, paprika, white sugar, white wine vinegar, and mustard to the bowl. Mix everything together until well combined.
3. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Slice the bacon into small pieces and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
6. Bake the bacon in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until it is crispy and cooked through.
7. Remove the bacon from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Once the bacon is cool enough to handle, crumble it into small pieces and add it to the egg mixture.
9. Stir the bacon into the egg mixture until everything is well combined.
10. Pour the mixture into a serving dish and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
11. Serve the Deviled Egg Dip with crackers, vegetables, or bread for a delicious appetizer or snack.

Enjoy your homemade Deviled Egg Dip!

7f30a2be89.gt:
Cook fries while chopping veggies.
Add everglades seasoning to fries if you live or got this from Florida.
Coat skillet with olive oil cooking spray.
Cook meat & add salt, pepper & Worcestershire sauce.
Drain liquid, add chopped veggies and 1/2 can sauce.
Cover & cook until fries are done.
Same time as meat cook 1/2 pound of pasta.
Add 1 teaspoon salt to water.
Place pasta on plate, meat sauce on top of that, add your favorite cheese, sliced Apple and top fries with fry sauce.
7f30a2be89.pred:
To prepare Stewz Meaty Apple Pasta #2, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
2. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the onions, celery, and mushrooms to the pot and cook until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the asparagus and green onions to the pot and cook until they are slightly wilted.
5. Pour in the canned spaghetti sauce and stir to combine with the meat and vegetables.
6. Add the pasta to the pot and stir to coat with the sauce.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
8. Stir in the french fries and black pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Stewz Meaty Apple Pasta #2 hot, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

The essential ingredients for Stewz Meaty Apple Pasta #2 are: 1 salt,1 black pepper,1 worcestershire sauce,1 french fries,1 can spaghetti sauce,1/2 lb pasta,1 lb lean ground beef,3 bunch green onions,4 asparagus,6 medium black olives,2 stick celery,1 mushroom.

d47548a7fa.gt:
Preheat the oven to 450.
In a small saucepan, combine the figs and wine and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over moderately low heat until the figs are plump, 15 minutes.
Drain the figs; reserve the wine for another use.
Transfer the figs to a food processor and process until finely chopped.
Scrape the figs into a bowl.
Stir in the olives and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil; season with pepper.
In a large ovenproof skillet, heat the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil.
Pat the lamb chops dry, season with salt and pepper and add to the skillet.
Cook the chops over moderately high heat, turning once, until browned, about 8 minutes total.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and roast the chops for about 4 minutes longer, or until a thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the meat registers 125 for medium-rare.
Transfer the lamb chops to plates and serve with the olive-fig relish.
d47548a7fa.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the dried black Mission figs, Syrah or other dry red wine, and pitted kalamata olives. Allow the mixture to sit for about 30 minutes to marinate.
3. In a small bowl, mix the extra-virgin olive oil, freshly ground pepper, and salt.
4. Season the lamb loin chops with salt and pepper.
5. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and sear the lamb chops for about 2 minutes on each side, or until they are browned and cooked through.
6. Remove the lamb chops from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
7. Pour the marinated mixture over the lamb chops, ensuring they are covered evenly.
8. Roast the lamb chops in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the figs are tender.
9. Remove the lamb chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Pan-Roasted Lamb Chops with Olive-Fig Relish dish!

f140cdb94b.gt:
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar and water.
Cook, stirring frequently, until sugar is dissolved.
Stir in vanilla and almond extract.
Cool, and refrigerate.
To serve: In a punch bowl with ice, mix 1 cup syrup with 2 liters ginger ale or lemon-lime soda.
f140cdb94b.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar and water.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
3. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the sugar is fully dissolved.
4. Add the clear imitation vanilla extract and almond extract to the mixture, stirring well.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
7. Discard the solids and pour the liquid into a large pitcher.
8. Refrigerate the pitcher until the punch is chilled and ready to serve.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

163e13f061.gt:
Pre heat over @ 350-375 place cut up butter on the of the pan
Cut up the cauliflower and place in bowl add all ingredients and mix up .. Add any extra to taste
Place in pan and then in the oven for about 20-30 mins until its golden brown.. Stir once or twice to mix in the melted butter ..
Enjoy!
163e13f061.pred:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the cauliflower into florets and place them in a large mixing bowl.
3. In a small bowl, mix together 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp adobo, 1 tbsp garlic powder, 1 black pepper, and 1 crushed pepper (optional).
4. Pour the seasoning mixture over the cauliflower florets and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the cauliflower florets out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and slightly browned.
6. Remove the cauliflower from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes

6fc30c421c.gt:
Place all the ingredients in a blender and blend until it becomes smooth and creamy.
If its too thick, dilute with water.
Infuse love and enjoy with any salads you can think of.
6fc30c421c.pred:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the chopped pear, macadamia nuts, and olive oil.
2. Slowly drizzle in the vinegar while continuously whisking the mixture.
3. Add a pinch of salt to taste.
4. Continue whisking until the dressing reaches the desired consistency.
5. If the dressing is too thick, you can add a bit more olive oil to achieve the desired consistency.

This Vegan Creamy Pear and Macadamia Nut Salad Dressing is a delicious and healthy option for those looking to incorporate more plant-based ingredients into their diet. The combination of pear and macadamia nuts provides a unique and refreshing flavor profile, while the olive oil and vinegar add a tangy and slightly acidic note. The pinch of salt balances the flavors and enhances the overall taste of the dressing. This versatile dressing can be used as a base for various salads or as a dip for raw vegetables, making it a versatile and enjoyable addition to any meal.

4877a08f4e.gt:
In a bowl, whisk together the yogurt, black peppercorns, garlic and 2 tablespoons of water.
Gradually whisk in the olive oil until emulsified.
Stir in the herbs and season with salt.
4877a08f4e.pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, peppercorns, garlic, and olive oil.
2. Add the chopped herbs and mix well.
3. Season the mixture with salt, adjusting the amount to taste.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dressing for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
5. Serve the Peppered Herb-Yogurt Dressing over salads, sandwiches, or as a dip for raw vegetables.

55c9dcc2b4.gt:
Cut each cake roll into eight slices; set aside any chocolate coating that separates from rolls for garnish.
Line a 9-inch springform pan with cake slices so that the swirl of cream and chocolate is on it's side and can be seen when you take the springform pan off, completely covering the bottom and sides.
In a small bowl, whisk milk and pudding mixes for 2 minutes.
Let stand for 2 minutes or until soft-set.
Pour over cake.
Spread with whipped topping; sprinkle with any reserved chocolate coating.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
**Cook time does not include refrigeration time of two hours.
55c9dcc2b4.pred:
To prepare a delicious Chocolate Swirl Delight dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chocolate swiss rolls and cold milk. Mix well to ensure the chocolate is evenly distributed throughout the mixture.
2. Add the chocolate fudge instant pudding mix to the bowl, stirring until the pudding is fully incorporated and smooth.
3. Gradually add the whipped topping, stirring until the mixture is well combined and smooth.
4. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish, spreading it evenly across the bottom.
5. Bake the dish in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for approximately 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Once the dish is cool, cut it into equal portions and serve.

This delicious Chocolate Swirl Delight dish is perfect for a special occasion, a dessert, or simply as a treat for yourself or your loved ones.

8367b4bf0f.gt:
Cook the onion in a pan with a small bit of butter until soft.
Stir in the flour to create almost a roux for a minute or so.
Stir in the milk, a little at a time, and then bring up to boiling point.
Add the remaining ingredients and wait until the cheese has hit melting point.
Taste and season accordingly, serve warm with bread.
(I only need to add pepper).
8367b4bf0f.pred:
[/INST]

To make Cheese Onion Soup, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, sauté the chopped onion in butter over medium heat until it becomes soft and translucent.
2. Add the cheddar cheese and cook until melted and smooth.
3. Add the mustard, milk, and flour, stirring to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the cheese sauce has thickened.
5. Serve the Cheese Onion Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated cheese and a drizzle of mustard, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Cheese Onion Soup!

6dc87a736e.gt:
In a small frying pan, toast pine nuts over low heat, turning often, and cooking just until nuts are lightly browned.
Remove from pan and set aside.
If using fresh peas, shell enough to make one cup.
Bring a small pot of water to a boil and add peas.
Cook for about 2 minutes or until peas have brightened.
Rinse peas under cold water in a colander and set 1/3 of the peas aside.
In the bowl of a food processor, combine remaining 2/3 cup of peas, garlic, pine nuts, Parmesan, and salt and pulse until thoroughly combined.
With the food processor on, drizzle olive oil into the mixture though the pour spout in the lid until nicely combined.
Remove pesto from food processor and set aside.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add linguine and cook according to package instructions for al dente.
Drain pasta, reserving about 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Return pasta to the pot and add pesto, the 1/3 cup of remaining peas, and 1/4 cup of the pasta water.
Toss together until pesto adheres to the linguine, adding more pasta water if needed.
Serve immediately, sprinkling with black pepper and additional Parmesan cheese to taste.
Adapted from Smitten Kitchen.
6dc87a736e.pred:
1. Begin by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the pine nuts, garlic, and salt.
3. In a large bowl, combine the fresh peas, grated parmesan, and minced garlic.
4. Drizzle the olive oil over the pea mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the pea mixture to a baking dish and spread it evenly.
6. Roast the pea mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the pine nuts are golden brown and the peas are tender.
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Add the cooked linguine to the baking dish and toss to combine.
9. Season the pasta with black pepper to taste.
10. Serve the Fresh Pea Pesto Linguine immediately, garnished with additional grated parmesan, if desired.

[/INST]

6f3b4ebeac.gt:
Cut the apple/pear and ginger into fine pieces.
Thinly slice the chili.
Mix chili, ginger, syrup, cinnamon, orange juice and zest in a saucepan and heat until it is boiling.
Add the apples/pears and bring to a boil again.
Add walnuts and raisins, and boil for about 5 minutes.
Pour into a glass with a tight fitting lid and cool completely.
(It will thicken up a bit when cooled down.)
Store in the fridge for a few weeks.
Serve with home baked baguettes, artisan bread and lots of wonderful cheeses.
Yum!
Enjoy!
6f3b4ebeac.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the peeled and cored apples or pears with the fresh ginger, red chili, and cinnamon.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the maple syrup, orange zest, and juice together.
4. Add the walnuts and raisins to the apple and ginger mixture, and toss to combine.
5. Pour the maple syrup mixture over the apple mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and bake for about 45 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the chutney is slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the Apple Chutney with Ginger, Walnuts, and Raisins warm or at room temperature.

This delightful Apple Chutney with Ginger, Walnuts, and Raisins dish is a delicious and healthy option for a snack or dessert. The combination of apples, ginger, and spices creates a warm, comforting flavor profile that is both sweet and slightly spicy. The addition of walnuts and raisins adds a crunchy texture and natural sweetness, while the maple syrup provides a rich, slightly caramelized taste. This dish is perfect for sharing with friends and family, or enjoying on its own as a treat.

dba5f2108e.gt:
For the pork medallions: Heat grill to medium heat.
Place pork medallions in a bowl, add olive oil and spices.
Mix until all the pork is covered in the olive oil mixture.
Place pork on grill and cook 5 minutes per side.
Cover and let it rest for 5 minutes.
For the asparagus: Cut off the ends of the asparagus.
Place in a bowl and add olive oil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
Wrap each piece of asparagus with prosciutto.
Place asparagus on grill set on medium heat.
Turn every couple of minutes until asparagus is fork tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.
dba5f2108e.pred:

1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.

3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the seasoned pork medallions and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.

9. Serve the grilled pork medallions with prosciutto-wrapped asparagus on the side.

a7b0ef58c0.gt:
1.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium bowl.
Combine rind and next 3 ingredients (through pepper) in a small bowl.
Gently stir lime mixture into fruit mixture; cover and chill.2.
Just before serving, stir 1/4 cup coconut into pineapple mixture.
Sprinkle with 1/4 cup coconut.
a7b0ef58c0.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the orange sections, pomegranate arils, kiwifruit, and pineapple.
2. In a small bowl, mix the grated lime rind, fresh lime juice, and fresh orange juice.
3. Pour the dressing over the fruit mixture and toss to coat evenly.
4. Add the ground red pepper and flaked sweetened coconut, toasted and divided.
5. Toss again to combine all ingredients.
6. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

This delicious Pineapple and Orange Salad with Toasted Coconut dish is a refreshing and nutritious option for a light meal or a side dish. The combination of fruits, such as oranges, pomegranate arils, and kiwifruit, provides a variety of flavors and textures, while the toasted coconut adds a unique and delightful touch. The dressing made from lime juice and orange juice brings out the natural sweetness of the fruits, creating a delightful and satisfying dish.

9cac29f01e.gt:
Mash the avocados roughly with a fork.
I like mine a bit chunky so I dont go too crazy with the mashing.
Add in the minced garlic, diced jalapeno and diced red onion.
Stir in the diced tomatoes.
Add the juice of the limes and salt and pepper to taste.
9cac29f01e.pred:
1. Cut the avocados in half and remove the pit. Mash the avocado flesh with a fork or a potato masher.
2. In a large bowl, combine the mashed avocado, minced garlic, chopped jalapeno, finely diced red onion, chopped tomato, and juiced limes.
3. Add the salt and pepper to taste.
4. Mix everything together until well combined.
5. Serve the guacamole immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

255666c11a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325F.
In a bowl, cover the chipotle with hot water and let stand until softened, 30 minutes.
Bake the halved apples cut side down on a rimmed baking sheet for 30 minutes, until tender.
Let cool.
Scoop the apple pulp into a food processor and discard the skins.
Stem, seed and chop the chipotle; add it to the food processor and puree.
Meanwhile, spread the bread in a pie plate and bake the pieces for about 10 minutes, until golden.
In a saucepan, boil the hard cider with the vinegar, sugar and apple puree.
Simmer, stirring, until reduced to 3/4 cup, 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and season with salt.
Light a grill.
Grill the sausages over moderate heat, turning, until lightly charred on both sides and cooked through, 12 minutes.
Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
In a skillet, heat the oil until shimmering.
Add the broccoli and season with salt.
Cover and cook until browned, 2 minutes.
Stir in the mustard, caraway, cider sauce and 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and season with salt.
Serve the sausages with the broccoli and sauce, garnishing with the bread crumbs and apple matchsticks.
255666c11a.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the dried chipotle chile with 1/4 cup of water to create a paste. Set aside.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the broccoli florets and cook until they are tender but still crisp. Season with salt and pepper.
4. In a separate small bowl, mix the apple cider vinegar, light brown sugar, and caraway seeds. Set aside.
5. In a large bowl, combine the rye bread, crusts removed, and tear it into bite-size pieces.
6. In a separate small bowl, mix the apple pieces, cut into matchsticks, with the extra virgin olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
7. In a large skillet, heat the remaining oil over medium heat. Add the sausages and cook until browned on all sides. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
8. In the same skillet, add the apple cider mixture and cook until it has thickened slightly. Add the cooked broccoli and stir to combine.
9. Return the sausages to the skillet and toss everything together.
10. Place the skillet in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the sausages are cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
11. Serve the Smoked Pork Sausage With Hard Cider Sauce over the rye bread mixture. Optionally, garnish with the apple matchstick garnish.

[/INST]

09eb954485.gt:
Rinse and debeard mussels, discarding any with open shells.
Place oil and butter in a large saute pan and place over medium heat until butter has melted.
Add onion and saute until transparent.
Add the remaining ingredients (except the basil).
Cover and cook over medium-high heat for 8 minutes, or until all the shells have opened.
Add basil and stir, until it has wilted.
Divide mussels into 4 bowls, top with broth and serve with lots of crusty bread for dipping.
09eb954485.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the mussels, onion, tomatoes, capers, garlic, olive oil, and butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the white wine and fresh basil leaves.
5. Once the mussels are cooked, remove them from the shells and discard the shells.
6. Add the white wine mixture to the bowl with the mussels and onions, stirring to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the mussels are cooked through and the sauce is slightly thickened.
8. Serve the Penobscot Bay Mussels dish immediately, garnished with the fresh basil leaves.

[/INST]

7b0bd717e5.gt:
Soften the butter in the microwave and leave to cool slightly.
Sift the cake flour.
Separate the eggs.
Make meringue by whisking the egg whites, adding the sugar gradually until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks and whisk in the melted butter a little at a time.
Then add the milk and the sifted flour, and mix gently.
Add in the meringue from Step 2 and carefully fold it in with a rubber spatula.
Cook in a waffle maker.
(I set my waffle maker to the medium setting and cooked for 3-4 minutes.)
NOTE: Increasing the sugar to 50 g will produce deliciously sweet waffles that are great even without a topping (however, they'll be soft and moist as opposed to crunchy).
Recipe Photo The waffle pictured was dusted with powdered sugar and served with lightly whipped fresh cream (100 ml heavy cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, vanilla essence) and pineapple.
7b0bd717e5.pred:
To cook a delightful Light Waffles Made with Meringue dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, granulated sugar, and unsalted butter until smooth and well-combined.
2. Gradually add the milk to the egg mixture, whisking constantly to prevent any lumps from forming.
3. Sift the cake flour into the egg mixture, and whisk until the batter is smooth and free of any lumps.
4. Preheat your waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions.
5. Pour the batter into the waffle iron, distributing it evenly to ensure even cooking.
6. Cook the waffles according to the manufacturer's instructions, typically until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside and cooked through on the inside.
7. While the waffles are cooking, prepare the meringue. In a clean, dry bowl, whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Gradually add the granulated sugar, whisking continuously until the meringue is glossy and stiff.
8. Once the waffles are cooked, remove them from the waffle iron and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Spread a generous amount of meringue on top of each waffle, creating a layer of delicate, fluffy meringue.
10. Serve the Light Waffles Made with Meringue immediately, as the meringue will start to lose its fluffiness if left out for too long.

Enjoy your delicious Light Waffles Made with Meringue dish!

4cdb9f81ba.gt:
Add the creamed corn and water to a pot, and turn on the heat.
When the mixture starts to simmer, add the soy milk.
When the mixture starts to simmer again, add the consomme cube.
Once the consomme is dissolved, add the heavy cream.
Top with corn if you like, and done.
4cdb9f81ba.pred:
1. Begin by heating the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the canned creamed corn, soy milk, and heavy cream.
3. Add the Consomme cube and the water, and stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes.
5. Carefully remove the Consomme cube and discard it.
6. Add the corn to the pot and stir to combine.
7. If the soup is too thick, you can add a bit more soy milk or heavy cream to achieve the desired consistency.
8. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Corn Soup hot, with your preferred toppings.

Remember to use the appropriate cookware and utensils for this recipe, such as a large pot and a ladle. Also, make sure to handle the hot ingredients with care to avoid burns.

62880ae3e8.gt:
Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
Return the drained potatoes to the pot.
Pour the vegetable broth, thyme, rosemary, oregano, basil, onion powder, parsley, sage, and garlic over the potatoes; mash with a potato masher.
62880ae3e8.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, bring the vegetable broth to a boil.
3. Add the peeled and chopped potatoes to the pot, and cook until they are tender, approximately 20-25 minutes.
4. While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the herbs by crushing the dried thyme, rosemary, oregano, basil, sage, and parsley.
5. Once the potatoes are cooked, drain them and return them to the pot.
6. Add the minced garlic, onion powder, and herbs to the pot.
7. Using a potato masher or a fork, mash the potatoes until they reach your desired consistency.
8. Season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a serving dish, and serve them immediately.

This step-by-step procedure will guide you through the process of making delicious Italian Mashed Potatoes using the provided ingredients. The cooking time and temperature are adjusted to ensure that the potatoes are cooked evenly and to your desired level of tenderness. The herbs and spices are added at the appropriate stages to enhance the flavor of the dish.

ea0996a6a7.gt:
start be heating your water & white sugar & cinnamon stick together on high heat about 3 minutes you just want your sugar to desolve.
Now add in all your other ingredients lower temperatures to med- high heat stir well cook down 20-25 minutes consistently stiring till desired consistency.
Enjoy!
ea0996a6a7.pred:
[/INST]

To prepare the Cranberry & Apple Chutney, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, water, and cinnamon stick. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.

2. Add the diced apples and golden raisins to the saucepan, and continue to cook for about 15 minutes or until the apples are tender and the chutney has thickened slightly.

3. Add the cranberries, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, and cloves to the saucepan. Stir to combine.

4. Reduce the heat to low, and let the chutney simmer for about 10 minutes or until the cranberries have softened and the flavors have melded together.

5. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let the chutney cool for a few minutes.

6. Stir in the salt and all spice, and then transfer the chutney to a clean jar or container. Allow it to cool completely before storing it in the refrigerator.

Enjoy your homemade Cranberry & Apple Chutney on toast, as a spread, or as a side dish with your favorite meal.

df787a9219.gt:
Heat oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onions and saute until browned in spots, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add sweet potato and cook, stirring, until it starts to brown in spots, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir in garlic, jalapeno, cumin and salt; saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add water and cook, scraping up any browned bits, until liquid is absorbed, 3 to 5 minutes.
Stir in corn and black beans and cook until heated through.
Stir in cilantro and season with salt and pepper.
Serve with lime wedges.
Good rolled in a tortilla with sour cream and cheddar cheese.
df787a9219.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
3. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the sweet potato, garlic, jalapeno, and cumin to the skillet. Cook for another 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sweet potato is tender.
5. Add the corn, black beans, water, and salt. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the sweet potato is tender and the corn is cooked through.
7. Season with fresh ground pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Sweet Potato, Corn & Black Bean Hash hot, garnished with chopped cilantro and a wedge of lime.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
