1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, rolled oats, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt.
3. Add the melted butter, chopped nuts (if using), and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, vanilla, and milk.
5. Add the wet ingredients to the dry mixture, stirring until the batter is smooth.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.
8. Allow the brownies to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once cooled, you can dust the brownies with confectioners' sugar, if desired.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
The Tri-Level Brownies are now ready to be served and enjoyed. These delicious treats have a perfect balance of flavors and textures, with the crunchy rolled oats adding an interesting contrast to the rich, fudgy brownies. The combination of ingredients results in a delightful dessert that is both visually appealing and satisfying to eat.
<</SYS>>

c1c23779c6.gt:
Heat the cider, syrup, sugar and cinnamon sticks in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cook until the mixture is simmering, reduces by half and starts to thicken, about 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and let it cool completely.
Remove the cinnamon sticks, then pour over pancakes or use as desired.
c1c23779c6.pred:
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the 2 cups of apple cider, 3 tablespoons of light corn syrup, and 1 cup of light brown sugar.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the 2 sticks of cinnamon.
5. Allow the mixture to cool slightly before stirring in the 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter.
6. Store the apple cider syrup in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

This apple cider syrup recipe is a delicious and versatile addition to various dishes, such as oatmeal, pancakes, waffles, and even as a topping for ice cream. The combination of apple cider, light corn syrup, and light brown sugar creates a sweet and slightly tangy flavor, while the cinnamon adds warmth and depth to the syrup. The unsalted butter provides a rich, creamy texture that complements the other ingredients. Enjoy your homemade apple cider syrup!

85a7242daa.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. If making cupcakes, line about 30 muffin tins with paper liners (for cake, grease and line with parchment paper three 9-inch round cake pans).
In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In the bowl of your electric mixer, beat eggs and sugar until thick and creamy (about 2 minutes).
Blend in vanilla, oil and sour cream.
Add flour mixture and milk, alternating adding a little of each at a time, starting and finishing with flour.
Pour into your muffin tins filling each about 2/3 full.
Bake cupcakes 18-19 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
For cakes, divide batter evenly among the three cake pans and bake for 25-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Frost with your frosting of choice.
I have made this with vanilla buttercream (classic combo), with lemon cream cheese frosting, with strawberry buttercream, with chocolate buttercream, with magical frosting, with Swiss meringue buttercreamthey are delicious no matter what you top them with!
Much thanks for this recipe to my neighbor and friend, Lauren McIntyre!
85a7242daa.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, vanilla extract, and oil.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
5. Add the sour cream and milk, and mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 12-cup muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
7. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious The Most Awesome Vanilla (Cup)cake Ever!

579917be2c.gt:
Light the grill or heat the broiler.
Coat the chicken with 1 tablespoon of the oil and season with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.
Grill or broil until just done, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes and then cut crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the fusilli until just done, about 13 minutes.
Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain thoroughly.
In a large bowl, toss the pasta with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Add the chicken, artichoke hearts, scallions, parsley, the remaining 5 tablespoons oil, the vinegar, the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and the Parmesan to the pasta and toss well.
579917be2c.pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil.
3. Grill the chicken breasts until cooked through and slightly charred, flipping them halfway through the cooking process.
4. While the chicken is grilling, cook the pasta according to package instructions.
5. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, grilled chicken, artichoke hearts, scallions, and red-wine vinegar.
6. Add the olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste, and toss everything together.
7. Serve the Grilled-Chicken Pasta Salad with Artichoke Hearts immediately, garnished with chopped parsley.

[/SYS]

72a1d68c4d.gt:
Slice the jalapenos longwise and carefully remove all the seeds and veins.set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix up the Cornbread batter according to the box instructions, add in the Corn and 1 cup of the Cheddar.
Fill each Jalapeno half with some batter!
Careful, dont over fill them!
Sprinkle them all with the remaining 1/2 cup of Cheddar.
Place them on a baking rack & sheet pan, bake them at 350 for about 15-20 minutes, or until the Cornbread is firm and cooked through.
They will be puffed and cheesy too!
Alternatively put the dough in mini muffin tin and then place a slice of jalapeno on top or sneak it in the middle and put more cheese on top.
This is a milder approach.
72a1d68c4d.pred:
To make a delightful Cornbread Jalapeno Poppers dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Prepare your workspace by lining a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. Prepare your ingredients by washing and peeling the jalapenos, and grating the cheese.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the jalapenos, cheese, corn, and cornbread mix.
5. Mix the ingredients until well combined, ensuring that the cheese is evenly distributed.
6. Using your hands, shape the mixture into small balls or patties, about the size of a walnut.
7. Place the balls on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them evenly apart.
8. Bake the poppers in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Remove the poppers from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Cornbread Jalapeno Poppers dish!

a5c8eb3798.gt:
Cook the pasta in large pot of the boiling salted water until al dente.
Using a mortar and pestle, mash the salt and garlics together into a paste.
Warm the yogurt slightly in sauce pan.
Remove a small amount of warm yogurt from the pan, and stir together with garlic paste.
Stir this mixture into the remaining yogurt.
Drain the pasta and rinsed in cold water.
Place in caserol or deep serving dish, tosh with 1 table spoon of butter or margarine.
Tosh with half of the garlic - yogurt sauce.
Spread the remaining sauce over the pasta.
Garnish with the parsley.
For a very special dish, brown the pine nuts in two table spoon of butter or margarine.
Pour over the parsley.
Serve immediately.
a5c8eb3798.pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, typically boiling it for about 8-10 minutes or until it reaches the desired level of doneness.
2. In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, butter, garlic, salt, and parsley. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are well-incorporated.
3. If desired, add pine nuts to the yogurt sauce for an extra crunchy texture.
4. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and return it to the pot.
5. Pour the yogurt sauce over the cooked pasta and stir to combine.
6. If desired, add a drizzle of extra butter to the pasta and sauce mixture for a richer flavor.
7. Serve the pasta immediately, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

This cooking procedure results in a delicious and satisfying pasta dish with a creamy yogurt sauce that complements the angel hair pasta. The additional ingredients, such as pine nuts and butter, can be customized to suit individual preferences and enhance the overall dish.

1788cb51c4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place squash, cut sides down, in a 9x13 baking dish.
Pour water into dish around squash halves.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and easily pierced with a fork, about 1 1/2 hours.
Carefully remove the skin with a fork; it should be very easy to remove.
Top squash halves with butter and season with salt and pepper to taste.
1788cb51c4.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Place the butternut squash halves, cut-side down, on a baking sheet.
3. Drizzle each half with 1 tablespoon of melted butter.
4. Season the squash with salt and ground black pepper to taste.
5. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the flesh is tender and the skin is slightly crispy.
6. Remove the squash from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Carefully scoop out the flesh from the squash and discard the seeds and skin.
8. In a large bowl, mix the squash with the remaining melted butter, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Baked Butternut Squash as a side dish or a main course, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

63eaa4f8ef.gt:
In a 350 degree oven, toast the walnuts that have been tossed with the oil, salt and pepper.
Bake for about 5-6 minutes, being careful to not let them burn.
In a large saute pan or skillet over medium high heat, add the vinegar, garlic and oil.
As soon as they are hot, add the onions and cook for only 30 seconds or so.
Next add the cabbage and cook for just about 2 minutes, stirring continually, until color changes from bright purple to pink.
Season with salt, pepper and a dash more vinegar.
Remove the wilted cabbage to individual salad plates and top with the apples, walnuts, goat cheese, and herbs.
63eaa4f8ef.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the walnuts, oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the nuts evenly on a baking sheet and roast for 8-10 minutes, or until they are golden and fragrant.
3. In a large bowl, combine the shredded or sliced red cabbage, red apple, and garlic. Toss the ingredients together gently to mix.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Add the roasted walnuts to the salad and toss again to combine.
6. Serve the Warm Red Cabbage Salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

3cb86cf2f4.gt:
Wash 5 potatoes.
Cut into square pieces.
Preheat oil in skillet on stove top.
I use my iron skillet
Chop up 1/4 white onion on cutting board along with potatoes.
Chop up two green peppers on board.
Dust garlic powder over potato, onion, pepper mix
Place potatoes, onion and peppers in skillet.
Dust with salt and pepper for additional flavor.
Cook until golden brown or potatoes are tender.
Serves about 5, can serve more just cut up more potatoes.
One potato per person want to feed.
3cb86cf2f4.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes and cut them into evenly sized pieces.
3. Cut the onion into small, evenly sized pieces.
4. Cut the green peppers into small, evenly sized pieces.
5. In a large bowl, mix the potatoes, onion, and green peppers.
6. In a small bowl, mix the garlic powder and vegetable oil.
7. Pour the garlic powder and vegetable oil mixture over the potatoes and onion mixture.
8. Toss the potatoes and onion mixture to coat evenly with the garlic and oil mixture.
9. Spread the potatoes and onion mixture on a baking sheet or a large, oven-safe pan.
10. Roast the potatoes and onion mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and golden brown.
11. Remove the baking sheet or pan from the oven and let the potatoes and onion mixture cool for a few minutes.
12. Serve the sauteed potatoes as a side dish or a main course, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

fc990de78b.gt:
Cut leeks diagonally into thirds and then diagonally in half to form 6 triangular pieces from each leek.
Rinse under cold water; drain.
Melt margarine in a heavy skillet; add leeks.
Cook until lightly browned, stirring gently, approx 15 minutes.
Stir in the broth cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until golden and the broth has mostly evaporated.
fc990de78b.pred:
To make Poireaux Braises (Braised Leeks), you will need the following ingredients:
- 4 medium leeks, roots removed, outer leaves & tops removed, washed clean (about 2 1/4 lbs, you should have 6-inch of each leek left)
- 0.5 (14 ounce) can chicken broth (approx 3/4 cup)
- Salt
- 1 tablespoon margarine or 1 tablespoon butter

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat the margarine or butter over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook until they are softened and slightly browned, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the leeks simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
4. Season the leeks with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve the Poireaux Braises hot, as a side dish or as a component of a larger meal. Enjoy!

e766664a53.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F with a rack in the middle position.
Take a small slice off of the bottom of each potato so that they will sit flat, and then a small slice (about 1/4) from each end.
Make slices crosswise down the potato at 1/4 intervals, leaving 1/4 at the bottom.
Make sure you do not cut all the way through.
Rinse the sliced potatoes under cold running water, making sure water gets between each slice to wash away excess starch.
Place the potatoes on a plate, bottom side up, and microwave for 5 minutes (do not cover).
Flip the potatoes over, then microwave for another 5 minutes.
While the potatoes are in the microwave, make the topping.
Pulse the bread in a food processor until you have coarsely ground crumbs.
In a medium bowl, use a fork to mix the crumbs with the melted butter, cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, paprika, garlic powder, oregano, minced garlic, salt, and pepper until it forms a chunky paste.
Set aside.
When the potatoes are finished in the microwave, place them on a rimmed baking sheet.
Drizzle slowly with olive oil, so that it can run into the slices.
Fan the slices slightly, then dash each one with paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes, until the potatoes are cooked through and the edges are just starting to brown.
Remove from the oven and turn the broiler on.
Press the topping onto the top of the cooked potatoes, pressing into any slices that you easily can, but being careful not to rip the potatoes.
Place under the broiler for a couple of minutes, until the topping is bubbly and starting to brown.
e766664a53.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the potatoes into 1/4 inch (0.6 cm) thick slices.
3. In a large bowl, toss the potato slices with the olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
4. Spread the seasoned potatoes on a baking sheet or a large roasting pan.
5. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
6. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
8. Add the shredded cheese to the melted butter and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
9. Spread the cheese sauce over the cooled potatoes.
10. Sprinkle the grated Parmesan cheese over the top of the potatoes.
11. Return the potatoes to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

96a66bd364.gt:
Whisk the milk and oil together.
(The key to making this good and not tasting like oil is using a little less oil and a little more milk.)
Add flour, salt, and sugar.
Press on bottom of pie plate.
With a fork, poke holes in bottom and sides of crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
So easy and so good.
See Amazing Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie for ideas on what to make this with.
96a66bd364.pred:
To make a delicious Crumb Pie Crust, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the 1/2 cup of peanut oil, 2 tablespoons of milk, and 1-1/2 cups of flour. Mix until the dough comes together.
2. Add the 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of sugar to the dough, and continue to mix until the dough is smooth and well-combined.
3. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
4. Cover the dough and refrigerate it for at least 30 minutes to allow the ingredients to set and the dough to chill.
5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
7. Line a pie pan with the rolled-out dough, pressing it into the corners and up the sides of the pan.
8. Bake the pie crust in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
9. Remove the pie crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before filling it with your desired filling.

This method will yield a delicious, flaky Crumb Pie Crust that is perfect for use in various baked goods, such as pies, tarts, or even as a base for a crumbly crust for a fruit-based dessert.

79aa81e6ca.gt:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat; whisk in flour, and cook until flour turns from white to a nutty brown color, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir in onion and cook until transparent, about 5 minutes.
Add meats and brown until no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes; stir in Cajun seasoning and garlic powder; drain fat.
Cool to room temperature.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Use a 5 inch diameter round cookie cutter or cut around a saucer to make a round of dough.
Place a heaping tablespoon of meat filling in the center of each round.
Fold dough over filling and seal edges closed by pressing with a fork or fingers.
Repeat to make 15 pies, re-rolling dough scraps as needed.
Heat oil for frying in deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Deep fry pies in small batches until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Or bake pies on greased cookie sheets in preheated 350 degree F (175 degrees C) oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
79aa81e6ca.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the vegetable oil, all-purpose flour, onion, and Cajun seasoning. Mix well.
3. Add the bulk pork sausage and ground beef to the bowl, breaking them up with your hands. Mix until the meat is well-coated with the flour mixture.
4. Add the garlic powder to the bowl and mix until well-incorporated.
5. Roll out the refrigerated pie dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch. Cut the dough into 4 equal pieces.
6. Place the dough pieces on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Carefully spoon a small amount of the meat mixture onto the center of each dough piece. Fold the dough over the meat, pressing the edges together to seal the filling.
8. Carefully transfer the filled dough pieces to the hot oil in the pot or deep fryer. Fry for about 3-4 minutes, or until the dough is golden brown and the filling is cooked through.
9. Remove the pies from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs and place them on a wire rack to drain.
10. Serve the Natchitoches Meat Pies warm.

[/INST]

[/INST]

[/INST]

24c12168e6.gt:
Insert wooden craft sticks or lollipop sticks into the cores of the apples at the stem.
Place the roasted peanuts and candies on separate plates.
Set aside.
Place the chocolate into a metal or glass bowl and set over a pan of barely simmering water.
Stir frequently until melted.
Remove from the heat.
Dip apples into the melted chocolate, turning to coat completely.
Dip or roll in candy or nuts, then place on a sheet of waxed paper.
Repeat with remaining apples.
Allow apples to set at room temperature until the chocolate is firm, about 20 minutes, before serving.
24c12168e6.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash the apples thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. Cut the apples into quarters, leaving the core intact.
4. In a small bowl, mix the chopped roasted peanuts and candy-coated milk chocolate candies.
5. Melt the semisweet chocolate in a double boiler or a heat-resistant bowl set over a pot of simmering water. Stir occasionally to prevent the chocolate from burning.
6. Dip each apple quarter into the melted chocolate, coating it evenly.
7. Immediately roll the chocolate-coated apples in the mixture of chopped roasted peanuts and candy-coated milk chocolate candies.
8. Place the coated apples on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Refrigerate the apples for at least 30 minutes to allow the chocolate to set.
10. Once the chocolate is set, serve the Chocolate Dipped Apples immediately or store them in the refrigerator for up to a week.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Dipped Apples!

d44553522d.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook bacon in large skillet until crispy, about 5 min.
; drain.
Set bacon aside.
Add ground beef, onions and peppers to skillet; cook 5 min.
or until ground beef is browned, stirring constantly.
Stir in tomato sauce; cook 3 min.
or until heated through.
Remove from heat; stir in olives, raisins and reserved bacon.
Spoon mixture into 13x9-inch baking dish.
Combine prepared corn muffin batter and cheese in medium bowl.
Spoon evenly over meat mixture.
Bake 20 min.
or until corn muffin topping is completely baked and golden brown.
Cool slightly before serving.
Top each serving with sour cream.
d44553522d.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is no longer pink. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the onion and red pepper to the skillet and cook until they are tender.
4. Stir in the tomato sauce, green olives, raisins, and corn muffin mix. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Top the beef mixture with the sliced bacon.
7. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream and chopped green olives. Spread the mixture over the bacon.
8. Sprinkle the prepared corn muffin mix over the top.
9. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the corn muffin mix is golden brown and the casserole is hot and bubbly.
10. Let the casserole rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Cornbread Topped Beef Casserole combines the flavors of the ground beef, tomato sauce, and green olives, with the added texture and taste of the corn muffin mix and sour cream. The crispy bacon and chopped red pepper add a contrasting crunch and a hint of spiciness, while the raisins and corn muffin mix contribute a sweet and slightly sweet, moist texture. The sour cream and green olives add a creamy and tangy element to the dish, making it a delicious and satisfying meal.

c79e2e0b30.gt:
Stir together chopped eggplants, onions, 1/4 cup olive oil and salt to taste in a large roasting pan, then roast the mixture on the second-lowest oven rack at 425 degrees for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add in zucchini, bell peppers and 2 tablespoons oil and more salt; return to oven and roast for another 20-25 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender.
Meanwhile, while veggies are roasting in the oven (or you can prepare this hours in advance also) in a large saucepan, simmer the chopped tomatoes, garlic, thyme and remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and bit more salt to taste; simmer about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until thickened.
Remove the roasting pan and stir in the tomato mixture into the roasting pan.
Add in about 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese; stir to combine, and season with black pepper and more salt if needed; set the roasting pan aside.
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water seasoned with about 1 tablespoon salt; cook until JUST firm-tender; drain.
While the pasta is cooking, stir in fresh parsley and basil to the veggies in the roasting pan; mix to combine.
Add in the cooked drained pasta to about 1/3 of the veggie mixture; toss to combine.
Spread the remaining cooked pasta on a large serving dish and top with remaining ratatouille on top.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
c79e2e0b30.pred:
To prepare Vegetable Ratatouille With Pasta, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large oven-safe skillet or a deep oven-safe dish, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the eggplant squares, onions, and garlic to the skillet. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender but not mushy.
4. Add the zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper (or red and yellow peppers), and plum tomatoes to the skillet. Cook for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
5. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a large mixing bowl.
7. Add the pasta to the skillet and toss it with the vegetables to combine.
8. Transfer the pasta mixture to the prepared baking dish.
9. Drizzle a little more olive oil over the top of the pasta mixture.
10. Bake the Ratatouille and pasta in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the Ratatouille is bubbly and slightly browned.
11. Remove the Ratatouille and pasta from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
12. Serve the Ratatouille and pasta hot, garnished with fresh parsley and basil.

Enjoy your delicious Vegetable Ratatouille With Pasta!

9fd9690bf2.gt:
1.
Mix all ingredients together.
2.
Cook in a greased 9 springform pan at 400 degrees F for 3035 minutes, or until cooked in the center.
3.
Cool and cut into wedges.
9fd9690bf2.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Jiffy Corn Muffin Mix, Creamed Corn, Milk, eggs, and grated cheese.
3. Mix the ingredients until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
5. Bake the muffins in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
6. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing them from the muffin tin and transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and satisfying Easy Corn Bread.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.
Whisk together the sugar, flour, salt and cocoa powder in medium mixing bowl.
Blend in melted butter.
Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until well blended.
Pour into the pie crust and bake 45 minutes.
The filling will be soft in the center but not runny; do not overbake, as it will set up some as it cools.
If crust gets too brown, cover with a pie shield or aluminum foil.
Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)
I think it is best served warmed.
I micowave a slice for about 20 seconds on high.
Top with your choice of ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped cream, nuts and cherries.
1b81060720.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, and cocoa powder.
3. Add the melted butter and mix until the dough comes together.
4. Press the dough into a disk and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and vanilla extract.
6. Roll out the chilled dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
7. Line a 9-inch pie pan with the rolled-out dough, pressing the edges to form a crust.
8. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden.
9. Allow the crust to cool completely.
10. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until well combined.
11. Add the melted butter and mix until smooth.
12. Stir in the cocoa powder and vanilla extract.
13. Pour the filling into the cooled crust.
14. Bake the pie for 30-35 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
15. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.
db5fd3bd93.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, cook the bacon over medium heat until it is crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, cook the onion, green pepper, and garlic over medium heat until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the pork and beans, and cook until the beans are heated through.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked beans, bacon, barbecue sauce, ketchup, picante sauce, molasses, maple syrup, brown sugar, liquid smoke, dry mustard, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 30-45 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
7. Serve the Bold and Saucy Baked Beans hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

0bb9567cbe.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Separate each biscuit into 3 pieces.
Place on baking sheet.
Combine the cheese, mayo, onion, bacon, sugar, garlic salt and hot pepper sauce in a medium bowl; mix well.
Place a spoonful of the mixture, spreading evenly, on each biscuit round.
Bake 10 minutes or until golden.
0bb9567cbe.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked crumbled bacon, mayonnaise, sugar, and garlic salt. Mix well.
3. Add the grated cheese to the mixture, and stir until the cheese is evenly distributed.
4. Add the onion, and mix until well combined.
5. Place the cooked biscuits into a large mixing bowl.
6. Pour the bacon mixture over the biscuits, and mix until the biscuits are evenly coated.
7. Spread the mixture evenly over a baking sheet or a large, greased baking dish.
8. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the biscuits are golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the Bacon Biscuit Puffs immediately, or let them cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

ae95df029b.gt:
Cream butter, sugar and splenda in a mixer.
Beat in apple sauce + eggs one at a time; add vanilla extract.
Mix flour, baking soda and baking powder in a bowl, add 1/2 to mix; beat - add yoghurt - beat - add remaining flour mix.
Stir in rhubarb.
Add batter to medium muffin cups.
In small bowl - mix topping ingredients and sprinkle on top of muffins.
Bake at 350 F - for 25 min or until golden.
ae95df029b.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, applesauce, sugar, Splenda, eggs, and vanilla extract.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the nonfat yogurt, flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, and butter (if using).
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Fold in the chopped rhubarb.
6. Pour the batter into muffin cups, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes in the pan, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/SYS]

These Rhubarb Muffins are a delicious and healthy treat, perfect for a breakfast or snack. The combination of the tangy rhubarb, sweet applesauce, and the soft buttery texture of the muffins makes them a delightful treat for everyone.

df67994fb9.gt:
Cream the butter and sugar.
Beat in the egg, vanilla and almond extracts.
Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Mix until well blended.
Fold in the almonds and coconut.
Cover dough and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and grease cookie sheets.
Roll dough into 1/2 inch rolls and cut into 1 1/2 inch lengths.
Bake 18 to 20 minutes, or until golden.
Dip in confectioners' sugar and let cool.
df67994fb9.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sifted flour, baking powder, salt, and egg. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the white sugar, softened butter, vanilla extract, and almond extract to the bowl. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Fold in the chopped almonds and shredded coconut.
5. Scoop the dough into small balls, and roll them in the confectioners' sugar to coat them evenly.
6. Place the coated dough balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Coconut Fingers!

8c32c6a022.gt:
Make the dough.
Put all the dough ingredients except for the olive oil into a plastic bag, and knead it well to make the dough.
When the dough comes together, add the olive oil and keep kneading (10 minutes).
Leave it to rise in the bag (30 minutes).
When the dough has risen, press it down lightly to deflate.
Place it on a kitchen parchment paper lined oven tray and leave to rest for 10 minutes.
Cut up the toppings for the pizza crust.
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Slice the onion and cherry tomatoes.
Defrost the seafood mix.
Put olive oil on your hands, and spread the dough out to cover the oven tray.
Preheat the oven to 300C (or 250C if your oven doesn't get that hot).
Spread the dough with pizza sauce, and cover evenly with toppings of your choice.
Add the pizza cheese to finish.
Bake at 300C for 13 minutes.
Top with something like fresh basil leaves and cut into 8 portions.
It's very hot so be careful.
I tried varying the toppings by section.
You won't get bored with the toppings this way, and looks like fun too.
8c32c6a022.pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To make a delicious pizza for guests, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake flour, bread flour, sugar, salt, and dry yeast.
3. Gradually add the lukewarm water, olive oil, and mix until a smooth dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Punch down the dough and roll it out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch.
7. Spread a thin layer of pizza sauce on the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
8. Add the wiener sausages, onion, mixed frozen seafood, cherry tomatoes, and mozzarella cheese evenly across the pizza.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving to your guests.

Enjoy your delicious homemade pizza!

8a42a2a009.gt:
On 1 slice of bread, spread a light layer of sweet and spicy mustard.
Meanwhile, preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lay the pieces of oven-roasted turkey on the mustard side of the bread; then add the roasted red peppers and top with the smoked provolone.
Put the sandwich on a baking tray in the oven and cook for 3-4 minutes (until the cheese just starts to melt).
Remove from oven and put on a piece of red leaf lettuce and go!
8a42a2a009.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the Foccacia bread into 4 equal pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the Sweet and Spicy Mustard with a drizzle of olive oil.
4. Spread a thin layer of the mustard mixture on each piece of Foccacia bread.
5. Place the bread on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Bake the bread for 10-12 minutes, or until it is golden brown and crispy.
7. While the bread is baking, prepare the turkey.
8. Remove the turkey from the deli package and rinse it under cold water. Pat it dry with paper towels.
9. Season the turkey with salt, pepper, and any other desired herbs or spices.
10. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat. Add a drizzle of olive oil to the pan.
11. Add the turkey to the pan and cook until it is browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
12. Remove the turkey from the pan and place it on a plate.
13. Add the roasted red peppers to the pan and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes, until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
14. Remove the roasted red peppers from the pan and place them on a separate plate.
15. In a small bowl, mix the Smoked Provolone cheese with a drizzle of olive oil.
16. Spread the cheese mixture on the slices of Foccacia bread.
17. Place the cheese-covered bread slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
18. Bake the bread for 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
19. Carefully slice the roasted red peppers and place them on top of the melted cheese.
20. Place the slices of Smoked Provolone cheese on top of the roasted red peppers.
21. Serve the Turkey with Smoked Provolone

e621c384f2.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment.
Unfold pastry and cut into 4 equal squares.
2.
Spread 1 teaspoon mustard on each pastry square, leaving 1/4 inch border.
Layer 1 slice turkey, 1 slice Swiss, and 1 slice ham in the center of each square.
Whisk egg with 1 tablespoon water; brush onto edges of the square.
Fold squares to form triangles and crimp edges to seal.
Place on a baking sheet and brush with remaining egg mixture.
3.
Bake pastries for 25 minutes or until golden.
Dust with sugar and serve with preserves on the side.
e621c384f2.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the honey mustard, egg, and sugar until well combined.
3. Cut the puff pastry into 4 equal squares.
4. Place a slice of smoked ham, a slice of Swiss cheese, and a slice of smoked turkey on each square of puff pastry.
5. Pour the honey mustard mixture over the filling.
6. Roll the puff pastry over the filling, enclosing it completely.
7. Brush the edges of the pastry with water to help the pastry seal.
8. Place the pastry on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake the pastry for 15-20 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the Puff Pastry Monte Cristo warm.

Please provide the step-by-step instructions for cooking a delicious Puff Pastry Monte Cristo from scratch using the following ingredients: 1 whole Sheet Frozen Puff Pastry (half Of A 17.3 Oz Package) Thawed,4 teaspoons Honey Mustard,4 slices Smoked Turkey,4 slices Swiss Cheese,4 slices Smoked Ham,1 whole Large Egg,2 Tablespoons Confectioners Sugar,13 cups Raspberry Preserves.

a004c9c6ff.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Butter 8x8x2-inch glass baking dish.
Cook sausage in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat until brown, breaking into small pieces with back of spoon, about 5 minutes.
Mix in flour, then milk.
Cook until mixture thickens and comes to boil, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Layer potatoes in prepared dish.
Top with 1/3 of green onions, 1 cup cheese, 1/3 of green onions, sausage mixture, sprinkle the herbs on top, and the remaining 1/4 cup cheese.
Bake casserole until potatoes are tender, about 45 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining green onions and serve.
a004c9c6ff.pred:
To prepare a delicious Breakfast Sausage and Hash Browns Casserole, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 16 ounces breakfast sausage, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, and the grated sharp cheddar cheese. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the 12 cups milk and the 16 ounces frozen hash brown potatoes.
4. Add the whisked milk mixture to the sausage mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Add the chopped green onions and fresh parsley to the mixture.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the sausage is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Breakfast Sausage and Hash Browns Casserole is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of sausage, cheese, and hash browns. The combination of ingredients creates a hearty and filling dish that can be enjoyed for breakfast or brunch.

629fc487a6.gt:
Heat butter in saucepan over medium heat until foaming.
Add onion and garlic to butter.
Cook until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Add curry powder, stirring to coat the onions well.
Add corn, stir, and continue to cook.
In a small bowl, add the coconut milk slowly to the cornstarch, stirring to prevent lumps.
Add this mixture to the corn mixture, stirring well.
Add remaining ingredients.
Lower heat, and cook for about 7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
The coconut milk should be mostly absorbed.
Serve warm.
629fc487a6.pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the curry powder and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
3. Add the corn, cornstarch, coconut milk, tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the corn is tender and the sauce has thickened.
5. Serve the Curried Corn hot over rice or with your favorite side dish.

Enjoy your delicious Curried Corn!

26c6578eb7.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 375 F. 2.
Combine egg, ricotta, spinach, pepper and salt in a mixing bowl.
3.
Spray a 9 by 13 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
4.
Lay the chicken breasts into the dish.
Top each breast evenly with the cheese mixture.
Roll up the chicken breasts so that the cheese mixture is inside of the roll.
Set the chicken rolls in the dish, seam side down.
5.
Pour the tomato sauce evenly over the top of the chicken breasts.
6.
Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella over the tops.
7.
Bake for 35-45 minutes at least, or until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling!
Calories per serving: 205* Fat: 6g* Fiber: 1g* Carbs: 4g* Protein: 33g* Points+: 5* Old Points: 4*

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the egg, ricotta cheese, spinach, pepper, and salt.
3. Place the chicken breasts in a single layer in a baking dish.
4. Pour the tomato sauce over the chicken breasts, and then top with the spinach mixture.
5. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the top.
6. Bake the chicken for about 35-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the chicken from the oven, let it rest for a few minutes, and then serve.

ccc0ef6d85.gt:
Melt butter in large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add leeks; saute until tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in parsley.
Cool.
Spread leek topping evenly over pizza shell; sprinkle tomatoes over.
Top with cheese.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil over.
Bake about 10 minutes at 450 F.
Remove from oven and brush crust with olive oil.
ccc0ef6d85.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the 12 tablespoons of butter, minced parsley, and a pinch of salt.
3. Spread the butter mixture evenly over the bottom of a 9-inch (23cm) round pizza pan.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the sliced leeks, tomatoes, crumbled goat cheese, and a pinch of salt.
5. Spread the leek, tomato, and goat cheese mixture evenly over the buttered pizza pan.
6. Drizzle the olive oil over the top of the pizza.
7. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Leek, Tomato, Goat Cheese Pizza!

8c72bca7c7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat olive oil in a large skillet; cook and stir zucchini, onion, and bell pepper in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in green chiles, eggs, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper; set aside.
Mix sour cream and flour in a bowl.
Layer half the corn tortillas in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread half the zucchini mixture and half the sour cream mixture on top; sprinkle with half the Cheddar cheese.
Repeat the layers.
Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.
8c72bca7c7.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced zucchini and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the chopped onion and green bell pepper to the pan, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until they are tender.
4. Add the drained green chiles, hard-cooked eggs, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper to the pan. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sour cream, all-purpose flour, and shredded Cheddar cheese.
6. Pour the mixture over the zucchini and vegetable mixture in the pan. Stir to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake the Tortilla Zucchini Casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Tortilla Zucchini Casserole hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Tortilla Zucchini Casserole!
